text: Now, for the mean, which is the average. Box plots don't directly show the mean; they show the median and quartiles. The mean can be influenced by outliers and the shape of the distribution. So, even if we know the medians, we can't be certain about the means unless the distributions are symmetrical. If the data is skewed, the mean can be pulled towards the tail.
